title.narrative: Multi Donor Trust Fund for Development Marketplace for African Diaspora in Europe (DMADE)

description.narrative: D-Made is a market-based grant giving mechanism that allows the World Bank, along with its partners and sponsors, to work with civil society organizations and entrepreneurs on innovative poverty fighting ideas. It is targeted to rewarding entrepreneurial diasporaactivities and projects that improve the delivery of social services, mainly in health and education, and create employment opportunities for the poor in Sub-Saharan Africa. D-Made is also a knowledge forum and continuous learning process to share ideas and provide networking opportunities. More specifically, the overall objectives are to: - Enhance the role of diasporas in the delivery of services reaching the poor in countries of origin. - Highlight ways of scaling-up existing experiences in which diasporas (including business, civil society organizations, etc.) worktogether with local actors to improve basic service delivery. - Promote entrepreneurship amongst African migrants in Europe, who can play a catalyst role in creating employment and growth, witha positive impact on social welfare. - Provide networking opportunities and create partnerships between Africans in the diaspora and other key constituencies (private/public sectors) in Europe and Africa. - Promote transfer of technology and knowledge as well as stimulate political, social and cultural exchanges.
